page.title: 06Employment,Sellindge 1985.
page.content: The working population of the area is involved in a wide variety of lines of employment such as farming,finance, education,manufacturing,engineering, retail and wholesale trades,industrial research and transport.Most work in the larger urban areas of Ashford, Folkestone and Canterbury,though some work further afield in Maidstone or London.Since by far the majority of working residents work outside the locale,this is mainly a dormitory area.The level of unemployment is below the national average,much work being available during harvest periods for casual labour,particularly women, in order to assist with the harvesting of vegetable and soft fruit crops. However,school leavers are finding it increasingly difficult to obtain long term jobs locally and are hence having to move to other parts of Britain.
